p: From donor to PRBC units there was a significant increase in RBC count (mean increase +1886 ± SD1399 μL/10 3), Hb concentration (+2.8 ± 2.2 g/dL), Hct percentage (+8.3 ± 5.5%). Significant reduction was found in PLT count (−249 ± 189 μL/10 3). Comparing PRBC at D0 and D42 a significant increase was found in percentage hemolysis (+ 1.2%), morphological index (+ 0.9) and a significant reduction in RBC count (−460 ± 679 μL/10 3), Hct percentage (−3.2 ± 3.5%), WBC count (median − 2589 μL/10 3), and PLT count (median − 43 μL/10). All blood cultures were negative for bacterial growth.
